strings: <se_low>Yangus: Me old mates in Pickham often talked about the legend'ry pirate, Captain Crow. We was always wond'rin' 'ow to get our 'ands on 'is treasure!

<se_low>Yangus: Rumour 'as it that it's 'idden in a cave somewhere.
Maybe this is the place!?

<se_high>Jessica: I never knew there was a cave here!
And it's quite close to Alexandria, too!
<se_high>Jessica: It just goes to show. Even though it was practically under my nose, I never would have noticed it if I hadn't joined forces with you guys!

<se_def>Angelo: This cave is enormous.
I can't believe it was big enough for us to come into by ship!
<se_def>Angelo: No doubt there have been some fairly shady goings-on here over the years, as well.<page>Angelo: Bound to be, with it being so hidden away from view like that.

<se_low>Yangus: I'm obviously a bit worried about Red, but it ain't just that.
I used to be a bandit an' all, y'see.
<se_low>Yangus: So talk o' Captain Crow's treasure gets me well excited!
<se_low>Yangus: Why don't we try an' get there first an' see wot it's all about?
<se_low>Yangus: Heh heh heh... Let's get goin' after Red, then!
<se_low>Yangus: We might still be able to catch 'er up!
<se_low>Yangus: Bleedin' 'ell! Red comes out wiv some nasty stuff sometimes...
<se_low>Yangus: Now I'm well wound up! I ain't lettin' 'er get to that treasure first!
<se_low>Yangus: Good ol' Captain Crow, 'idin' 'is treasure in a complexicated cave like this!
<se_low>Yangus: There's bound to be more traps ahead to try an' stop people findin' it.
<se_low>Yangus: We'd better watch 'ow we go, eh?

<se_low>Yangus: That bird's unbelievable!
She really wants this treasure, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: Well if we don't get a wriggle on, she's gonna 'ave it from under our noses!

<se_high>Jessica: Red seems to be out cold.
Come on, this is a golden opportunity!<page>Jessica: Let's grab the contents of the treasure chest before she wakes up!

<se_high>Jessica: After all, we fought Captain Crow fair and square. Even he agrees!
So she won't have any reason to complain.

<se_high>Jessica: It looks like Red was right!
We really don't have much luck!
<se_high>Jessica: We may have figured out the trick, but SHE'S the one to benefit from it! Grrr...!
<se_high>Jessica: Red must be pretty fearless, walking around a place like this all by herself.

<se_high>Jessica: I remember she said how good she was at sneaking about.
Looks like she was serious!
<se_high>Jessica: Someone explain to me how Red got ahead of us when WE were the ones who found the hidden door!

<se_high>Jessica: Yangus! Say something!
Where's that big mouth of yours when I need answers?
<se_low>Yangus: ...Why does it 'ave to be down to me, eh?

<se_high>Jessica: Okay, let me put it in simple terms for you.
WE unlocked the door! RED got ahead!

<se_high>Jessica: This is what happens when you have unfinished business with a woman, Yangus!
Do we understand each other?
<se_low>Yangus: ...Grr. I ain't got nuffin' to say to that.
<se_def>Angelo: It'll be a bit of a blow if the treasure turns out to be nothing special now that we've gone to all this effort.

<se_def>Angelo: Don't let us down, Captain Crow!
This had better be worth it!
<se_def>Angelo: I had my doubts about this right from the start.
<se_def>Angelo: It doesn't look like we have any chance of winning now, so maybe we should just give up and go.
<se_high>Jessica: Come on, Angelo, why are you so down all of a sudden!? I'm sorry, but I'm NOT giving up yet. That means you aren't either! Got it?

<se_def>Angelo: Calm down, darling!
If you need me that much, who am I to refuse!?
<se_high>Jessica: Good boy!
<se_def>Angelo: Do you really think there's pirate treasure hidden in here?

<se_def>Angelo: Maybe we'll find the chest and open it up to find it empty!
Let's hope not.
<se_def>Angelo: That bandit woman's intuition is formidable.
<se_def>Angelo: I'd have a devil of a time keeping secrets from a woman like that!<page>Angelo: She'd find out about my other lady friends before I'd even learnt their names!
<se_high>Jessica: You'd have that problem with any non-bimbo, Angelo. It's called ‘women's intuition’ and it has nothing to do with bandits, thank you very much!
<se_def>Angelo: I usually look forward to being reacquainted with a beautiful woman.

<se_def>Angelo: But not this one.
Her tricks and jibes are enough to soften any man's resolve.
<se_low>Yangus: Red's got a right nerve!
<se_low>Yangus: Why does she 'ave to make me feel like a loser even though I won!?
<se_low>Yangus: Makes ya think about Captain Crow's glory days, bein' 'ere in this cave.

<se_low>Yangus: ...Not that I really know much about 'em, mind.
I'm just imaginin' really.
<se_high>Jessica: I remember hearing something about a sea chart before. I don't know if it was the same as this one, though.
<se_high>Jessica: And I also remember something about a Godbird Island. What was it, again? Hmm...
<se_high>Jessica: Remember the silly competition we had with Red here?

<se_high>Jessica: When she got to the treasure ahead of us, I was sure we'd lost!
That was a close one.

<se_def>Angelo: So all we have to show for our efforts is a measly piece of paper.
Do you really think it's going to be of any use?

<se_def>Angelo: What's wrong, <hero>?
You're not thinking there's more pirate treasure hidden somewhere else, are you?

<se_def>Angelo: You can be very persistent at times.
Not to mention optimistic.
<se_low>Yangus: Oi! We ain't got time for chattin' now!
<se_low>Yangus: We've gotta do somefin' about that ghost-bloke an' save Red! Not before givin' 'er a piece o' me mind, though.
<se_high>Jessica: Wow! So the actual owner of the treasure appeared right before our eyes!
<se_high>Jessica: Does this mean we'll be guilty of robbery if we fight him and take it?
<se_def>Angelo: She may be good at creeping about, but she's not looking so clever now it's come to the crunch.
<se_def>Angelo: ...Right, we have a damsel in distress on our hands. Time for Angelo to come to the rescue.
<se_low>Yangus: Oi! We've gotta 'urry up back to the treasure room an' save Red!

<se_high>Jessica: This is no time for chatting!
We have to defeat Captain Crow!
<se_def>Angelo: Red's welfare isn't strictly my responsibility, but she is a beautiful woman so she falls within my jurisdiction.

<se_def>Angelo: I can't just leave a damsel in distress like that.
Time for Angelo to come to the rescue.
<se_low>Yangus: It's been a while now since we raced against Red 'ere to get Captain Crow's treasure.
<se_low>Yangus: Er, guv. Ya don't think we should let you-know-who pull out o' this lark before it gets too dangerous, do ya?

<se_low>Yangus: ...Nah, never mind.
It's nuffin'. I was just mumblin' to meself.
<se_high>Jessica: Thanks to the sea chart we found here, we met Empyrea. And thanks to helping her, we were given the ability to fly.
<se_high>Jessica: And now the ability to fly means that we can fight Rhapthorne. So I suppose we owe a big debt of gratitude to Captain Crow!
<se_def>Angelo: You've not come here to hide away from Rhapthorne, have you!?
<se_def>Angelo: It's true that he wouldn't be able to spot this place from the sky.

<se_def>Angelo: But we've come this far.
Now's hardly the time to start getting cold feet!
<se_low>Morrie: Si, the entrata here is hidden from the land above by the bridge, and the no one in their right brains is gonna try to navigate this way by boat, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: FANTASTICO! The perfect hideaway for a pirata leggendario!
<se_low>Morrie: Our rosa rossa, she is safe for now, uh? This is our chance to explore the treasure.
<se_low>Morrie: Anyways, I am smelling the rats here. She appears just at the momento we solve the enigma, ay? I don't wanna say she's using us, but...
<se_low>Morrie: The great hoard of this pirata leggendario is here, in this very cave!
<se_low>Morrie: If he has gone to such longs to hide his treasure, it must be something incredibile, ay!
<se_low>Morrie: Our ragazzo's nose for the treasure is as good as the nose of the professional thief, ay? Ah ha ha ha!
<se_high>Jessica: As good as, maybe, but not better! If we don't do something, she's going to beat us to it!
<se_low>Morrie: Maybe she's a little too fortunato, ay, our rosa rossa? She shows up just as we're unlocking the door? No no, this is no accident!
<se_low>Morrie: Where is the treasure, is the rosa rossa. Like you spend a bad penny, ay?

<se_high>Red: Well, that's that then. Not exactly a great 'aul,
is it? Legend'ry pirate? I reckon ev'ryone's been 'avin' a laugh.
<se_high>Red: All you can 'ope is that that scrap o' paper gives the location o' the real trove.
<se_high>Red: Nuffin' doin' 'ere now. No treasure at all.
<se_high>Red: Well, old Crow's ghost never said nuffin' about no other treasure about, so we're through 'ere, as far as I'm concerned.
<se_low>Morrie: If the map tells us something about the Godbird we are looking for, then we are in luck, ay? But can you make the sense out of it?
<se_low>Morrie: Si, I wanna be like this Capitano Crow <endash> a true leggenda. Morrie, leggenda of the monstrous pit! Monster team owner extraordinaire!
<se_low>Morrie: But then maybe people are gonna come looking in my house for the precious mementos of the great man, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: Hmmm, maybe I better throw some things away I don't wanna no one to see...
<se_low>Morrie: If an amico is in difficolta, we cannot stand beside and do nothing, ay? Even if we are face to face with a pirata leggendario!
<se_low>Morrie: We must find our GUSTO and save the rosa rossa! But we are fighting with a spirito. Don't let the ghost get you, ay?
<se_high>Red: Blimey, it feels like an age ago when we was battlin' it out 'ere for old Crow's treasure, eh?
<se_high>Red: And when I said I'd tag along wiv ya, I never thought I'd end up 'avin' to join in the fight against the Lord o' Darkness, I can tell ya.
<se_low>Morrie: Aha! Si, an excellent idea! Here, in this deep cave, the Rhapthorne will not see us making the battle plans, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: This can be our secret base! Ah ha ha, I love the secrets!
